Push 1 stop & Wiklow - 'Membrane'
SoÃÅnar Barcelona 2019

This was our first time at Barcelona's @sonarfestival. We later performed at @sonaristanbul the same year. This was in the Complex auditorium as part of the @weare.europe programming. Cadie (Push 1 stop) was on their "creative people" list for 2019 ü•≥.

The venue was cool. We learned a few things about our set-up, especially about projector lenses. ‚ö°Ô∏è

We also saw a really cool piece from an Italian duo with robotic lights as well in the same venue. I think it was "Black Symphony" by the @quiet_ensemble.

üì∏  Photo: @sergioalbert_ (Sergio Albert @ SoÃÅnar Barcelona)

Photo from "Liquid Architecture" - an #audiovisual #film and #performance for #surroundsound + #immersive #projections produced with the @sat_montreal [2018].

This show toured 8 different countries over a two-year span, including #planetariums, #dome #environments and was part an #international #tour with @sat_montreal.

#Visuals: @diagraf & @ewerx 
#Music: @michaelgarydean

#touchdesigner #canadian #beats #makemusic #composer #composition #art #maxforlive #electronicmusic #live #maxmsp #ableton #collaboration #abletonlive #vj #glsl #shaders

Oufff, this was my "Against the Clock" moment for @factmag in 2018.

I was definitely unprepared for this. In fact, any preparation would have been good. 

I had figured I'd just "wing it" since we were so busy preparing a new #performance, and that was a priority. In my mind, I wanted to be "#authentic" and to really show what 10 minutes of starting from scratch looked like. What's the worst that could happen?

So that 10 minutes went by pretty damn fast, and it didn't turn out great. Afterwards, it was hard to swallow. It didn't help that the stream has been seen by over 10 000 people.

I felt genuinely bad about it for a while. Just silly and mostly embarrassed. Eventually, I came around to being glad I put myself out there and had the courage to try this. Strangely, I think the experience actually gave me a bit more confidence in the end, to just go for it and put yourself on the line, even if it‚Äôs only to learn a lesson.

Since then, I have come to love sharing #behindthescenes and demystifying #creative processes. I absolutely love #teaching and giving #workshops, as well as working with students to help them advance their #practice. I now teach how you can be authentic, in-the-moment AND prepared - like good #jazz musicians! üòÜ

So no regrets. But lesson learned!

üì∏  Photo : @vivien.gaumand 

#teaching #composer #composition  #maxforlive #electronicmusic #liveperformance #reaktor #maxmsp #collaboration #abletonlive #livemusic #performer #creativity #electronicmusic #digitalart #abletonlive #creativecoding #montreal #performanceart  #musicperformance #generativeart #generativemusic

Here's another one of "Membrane" from @mutekmx, Mexico City (2018).

We shared this evening with a few artists who really influenced us: @foxalot + Atom TM as well as @tetsujiohno_intercityexpress. Cadie would later collaborate with Tetsuji Ohno in Japan on a performance that I liked very much. All fantastic artists and very pleasant individuals.

Push 1 stop & Wiklow - 'Membrane'

üì∏ Photo: @theozcorp (Oscar Villanueva @ MUTEK.MX)

I‚Äôve always strived to be an #artist that takes risks and experiments, even if it has meant #failing or looking silly at times. Looking silly has definitely happened. But at certain moments, the #risktaking has felt pretty good. 

This was a 2018 #performance of 'Membrane' (Push 1 stop & Wiklow) in Mexico City. 'Membrane' went through some ups and downs as we explored #improvisation and liveness, however there definitely were some fantastic moments of intimate connection while #performing with Cadie Desbiens-Desmeules (aka Push 1 stop), both with the audience and each other.

‚ÄúLive‚Äù in #electronicart can mean a lot of things, and exploring the space between well #practiced and things completely-falling-apart yields some interesting #lessons. There can be ‚Äúspecial moments‚Äù, but equally some risks are just not necessary and can negatively impact a show if taken too far. A certain #vulnerability is felt by an audience, but it has to stay in balance.

I recall this show was pretty raw, but felt good. The #production team at @mutekmx was first-class, and I remember the sound team did a fantastic job.

Push 1 stop & Wiklow - 'Membrane'
üì∏ Photo: @diego.noll (Diego Figueroa @ MUTEK.MX)

#touchdesigner #soundproduction #beats #composer #composition #drums #performanceart #art #maxforlive #electronicmusic #liveperformance #reaktor #maxmsp #collaboration #abletonlive #vj #glsl #shaders

The creative process is just never really finished! üôâ

In 2018 at @mutekmontreal, Cadie Desbiens-Desmeules (aka #Push1stop) and I premiered ‚ÄúMembrane‚Äù, an #audiovisual #performance for volumetric #projections. I wanted to share some photos from that very first show, before the work had really matured.

This first version was basically a prototype, but it was so necessary to bring the work into reality. We had created it during a residency at @pertedesignal during the weeks before. The premiere had a lot of issues, but what we learned was substantial. We were able to improve the result dramatically over the next year of presentations. 

Since the premiere, we've shown "Membrane" in many different countries, sometimes with multiple trips to each location. This process of constant refinement over several years really changed the way I view making an #artwork, or really any project in general. It's just never really finished, and that's just part of the process. The important thing is to get it out there, and to realize perfecting it will happen over time.

It's frightening to present new work. But now I feel like it's how to get started, rather than how to finish.

üì∏ Photos : @vivien.gaumand

#Paris!

#Lagaitelyrique is an exceptional venue. This was a unique #performance, with screens surrounding the entire venue and #surroundsound. The #soundsystem was awesome!

@diagraf and I played this show in 2018 during the @sat_montreal tour, just after #Berlin at the Zeiss Grossplanetarium. Cadie (#push1stop) and I had also done the European premiere of "Membrane" at @stereolux_scopitone in Nantes, France not long before. It was certainly a busy fall. Lots learned!

üìΩ Visuals:¬†@diagraf¬†&¬†@ewerx

One of those #performances where I thought, "why didn't I #record that!" üòÇ

This was a one-off, a #live #audiovisual set @diagraf and I performed for @mapp_mtl at @momentfactory in 2017. I loved the #mapping structure they did. It felt perfect for what Pat and I were doing at the time. 

This one was with just an @weareelektron #octatrack #sampler and I think Pat was in #Touchdesigner. It was the first time playing an #improvised set on a sampler. The basic tracks had been laid out, and then it was all flow from there. I remember having a really good time! ü•≥

üìΩ Visuals: @diagraf 
üì∏ Photo : @tadokoroyasuko

Here's one more from "Liquid Architecture". I liked this one because there‚Äôs a little glimpse of the "behind the scenes".

I learned a lot for future works during this project, especially that it‚Äôs best to keep things simple! There was a lot of technology to deal with here. Music, visuals, surround sound, video mapping, communication over OSC... It gave me some good knowledge for the next collaborations. üôè

üìΩ Visuals: @diagraf & @ewerx 
üì∏ Photo: @bruno_destombes

I think this is one of my favourite images of "Liquid Architecture", an #audiovisual #collaboration with #visual #artists @diagraf & @ewerx. This was taken at @mutekmx the #planetarium of the Papalote children‚Äôs #museum in 2017.

This was the ‚Äúfilm version‚Äù of the project and I think it‚Äôs one of the most dramatic scenes. I remember this was one of the last that Pat added, and it seemed to be one of the audience‚Äôs favourites.

It‚Äôs always weird to be sitting in the audience, but I must say I love this format.üòé

Visuals: @diagraf & @ewerx
Photo: unknown

Here‚Äôs another one of ‚ÄúLiquid Architecture‚Äù from @mutekmontreal 2017 at @sat_montreal.

I like seated #shows, especially for #immersive #audiovisual #performances. I love laying on your back and staring up into space. Better for the neck too üòÖ. I also like playing with the format for the #audience, and putting the performers off a stage and more a part of the audience itself. I always end sitting down even at clubs so laying down is like bonus!

üìΩ Visuals: @diagraf & @ewerx 
üì∏ Photo : @bruno_destombes

Continuing the trip down memory lane here‚Ä¶

This was one of the first shows Pat Trudeau and I did at la SocieÃÅteÃÅ des arts technologiques (@sat_montreal) for ‚ÄúLiquid Architecture‚Äù. I was learning a lot during this period. Especially about #surroundsound and creating a sort of conversation between #music and #visuals. Good memories but a lot of work! üòÖ

This was 2017 @mutekmontreal.

Ready!

I really try to make #music as an everyday thing. Maybe also for anything really that you're dedicated to. But I like the idea of #practice a lot. Sometimes it means not doing much, and that's fine. But a few steps always feels good. üòç

#music #portugal #homestudio #ableton #listening #spotify #producingmusic #synth #synthesizers #maxforlive #daw #orchestra #filmmusic #beats #maxmsp #reaktor #studiovibes #sundayvibes #808 #composer #makemusic #electronicmusic #audio #m4l #musicians

After years of DJing and record collecting, in 2015 I became intensely interested in turntables as a musical instrument, inspired by artists @djshadow, #christianmarclay etc. 

Combining a #sampler packed with #glitchy drum beats from the #experimental software known as @nativeinstruments #Reaktor, old #vinyls were covered in paint and clicky #techno rhythms were cut into the runout grooves using an x-acto knife. This came from obsession with the "post-digital", or #glitch, aesthetic defined by labels like @12k_label, @rastermedia and Line.

A new performance titled ‚ÄúSkeletal Wires" was the result, and premiered at @mutekmontreal 2015. It was the first time collaborating with MontreÃÅal's @diagraf, a #visual #artist known for his impressive #minimalist designs. We would later produce performances and film for planetariums, together with programmer/artist @ewerx.

üìΩ Visuals by @diagraf 
üì∏ Photos by @carolinehayeur @cassandra.sswell
